meanings.definition: Prepare (a vehicle or building) for winter conditions.
meanings.sent1: I need to winterise my car by putting on snow tires.
meanings.sent2: Every year, I winterise my house by insulating the windows.
meanings.sent3: I tried to winterise my bike by wrapping it in a blanket, but it looked silly.
meanings.sent4: She winterised her garden by covering the plants with a protective layer of mulch.
meanings.sent5: The old man taught his grandson how to winterise the cabin before the snowstorm.

meanings.definition: Make (something) suitable for use in winter.
meanings.sent1: To enjoy the snow, we need to winterise our boots with waterproof spray.
meanings.sent2: The company winterised their products by adding extra layers for warmth.
meanings.sent3: She tried to winterise her sandals by wearing thick socks, but it didn't work well.
meanings.sent4: The chef winterised the menu by adding hearty stews and hot drinks.
meanings.sent5: The hikers winterised their backpacks with extra blankets and hand warmers.

meanings.sent1: We need to winterise the camping gear for our trip to the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The farmers winterised the tractors by adding antifreeze to the engines.
meanings.sent3: He tried to winterise his shorts by wearing them over long johns, but it was uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: The city parks department winterised the playground by installing heated equipment.
meanings.sent5: She winterised her wardrobe by adding more sweaters and coats for the cold season.
